summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring observation at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by lieutenants and a captain, and the date corresponds to the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York conduct and document 30-minute observation checks on inmates held in the Special Housing Unit under continuous locked-down status.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is dated August 8, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
It consists of 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU), indicating routine inmate monitoring procedures.
The sheets cover multiple tiers (ZA Tier-G, H, J, K, M-Tier, L-Tier, ZB) within the SHU, suggesting widespread monitoring.
Procedures require staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
Each sheet is reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight for the monitoring logs.
